snippet: Federal law, international pressure and resistance from inside the C.I.A. stand in the way of Donald J. Trump using brutal interrogation tactics....
abstract: Pres-elect Donald Trump's campaign promise to bring back banned interrogation method of waterboarding faces number of legal and logistical hurdles; experts say even if Trump is able to circumvent federal law, international pressure and resistance with Central Intelligence Agency, it will be exceedingly difficult for his lawyers to argue that waterboarding does not cause lasting harm and thus is not torture.

byline.original: By MATT APUZZO and JAMES RISEN
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Sheri Fink from New York, and Helene Cooper, Charlie Savage and Jennifer Steinhauer from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Federal law, international pressure and resistance from inside the C.I.A. stand in the way of Donald J. Trump using brutal interrogation tactics.

headline.main: Donald Trump Faces Obstacles to Resuming Waterboarding
headline.print_headline: Plan to Revive Waterboarding Faces Obstacles

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
